name: Rainbow Energy

effect.text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy counts as every type of basic Energy but only provides 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, it does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)
effect.inPlayBehavior: Counts as every type of basic Energy
effect.notInPlayBehavior: Does not count as basic Energy

synergies: Pokemon that benefit from damage counters
tips: Essential for decks running multiple Energy types
The 10 damage can be used strategically with certain Pokemon
Only provides 1 Energy despite counting as all types
Can be searched with cards that find Special Energy

competitiveHistory: This is the non-holo reprint of Rainbow Energy (#17). Rainbow Energy was one of the most important Special Energy cards ever printed. Its ability to provide any type of Energy made multi-type decks viable and remained a staple card for years.

rulings.ruling: Rainbow Energy only provides 1 Energy, even though it counts as all types.
The 10 damage is dealt when you attach it from your hand. Moving it with cards like Energy Trans doesn't trigger the damage.
When not in play (in deck, hand, or discard pile), Rainbow Energy is not a basic Energy card.
